title: 2025 Thanksgiving Menu
steps: === CHICKEN & DUMPLINGS (Serves 6-8, ~1 hour) ===
OPTIONAL SMOKED CHICKEN STEP: Place chicken in smoker at 225°F (107°C) with apple/cherry wood for 45 minutes (not cooked through). Then proceed with recipe.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat 15g olive oil in large pot over medium-high.
Sear chicken 3 minutes per side. Rest 10 min, cut into chunks (discard bones). If smoked, skip cutting until after simmering.
Melt 70g butter in same pot. Add 150g diced onion, 120g carrots, 120g celery. Cook 5 minutes.
Add 10g minced garlic, 5g Worcestershire, 5g hot sauce, and seasoning mix (3g onion powder, 1g basil, 1g parsley, 1g thyme, 1g rosemary, 1g mustard powder, 0.5g sage, pinch pepper). Cook 1 minute.
Add 40g flour, stir 2 minutes. Gradually whisk in 1000g chicken broth, then 350g half & half.
Add bouillon cube if using. Add 100g frozen peas. Simmer gently.
Make dumpling dough: Mix 240g flour, 8g baking powder, 3g baking soda, 5g salt, 3g garlic powder, 8g sugar.
Add 180g cold sour cream, 60g cold milk, 57g melted butter. Fold JUST until combined.
Add chicken back into pot. Reduce heat to low.
Scoop dumplings on top using small scoop. Cover tightly. Simmer 15 minutes (don't open lid). Test dumplings; extend 3-5 min if needed. Serve.
=== SMOKED MAC & CHEESE (Serves 10) ===
Cook 450g elbow macaroni to al dente. Drain.
Preheat smoker to 225°F (107°C) with cherry/apple wood.
Make roux: Melt 113g butter in cast iron, whisk in 32g flour until smooth.
Whisk in 8g mustard powder. Add 475g half & half, bring to simmer.
Add 113g cream cheese, whisk smooth. Add 340g shredded cheddar and 170g smoked gouda. Melt fully.
Add cooked pasta, fold gently.
Mix 50g panko + 57g melted butter + 12g sweet rub (recommend reducing rub to 6g for balance).
Sprinkle topping over mac and cheese. Smoke 1 hour (up to 2 if desired). Serve warm.
=== VINEGAR COLESLAW ===
Make dressing: Whisk 120g apple cider vinegar, 50g sugar, 45g olive oil, 4g minced garlic, 6g kosher salt, black pepper, and 3g celery seed.
Combine 1600g shredded cabbage, 225g sliced onion, 170g grated carrots with 66g sugar + 24g salt (HALF the original amounts to avoid over-softening).
Rest 5 minutes. Rinse thoroughly in cold water. Spin or pat dry.
Toss with dressing. Adjust seasoning.
=== MUSTARD GREENS WITH HAM HOCK ===
Wash 750g mustard greens thoroughly, remove stems, chop.
Heat 20g olive oil in pot. Add 150g onion + seasonings (2g onion powder, 2g garlic powder, 2g crushed red pepper, black pepper, salt). Cook until translucent.
Add 18g garlic (6 cloves), cook 1 minute.
Add 1000g chicken broth + 900g smoked ham hock. Simmer 20 minutes.
Add greens + 15g apple cider vinegar + 10g brown sugar. Cover, simmer 1 hour until tender.
Pull meat from hock, chop, return to pot. Adjust seasoning. Add hot sauce if desired.
=== BUTTERMILK BISCUITS ===
Preheat oven to 475°F (246°C).
Grate 113g frozen butter directly into 300g White Lily self-rising flour. Chill bowl 10 minutes.
Add 240g cold buttermilk, mix 15 strokes. Turn onto floured surface.
Fold like a letter, roll, repeat 3 times. Roll to ¾-inch thick.
Cut biscuits (no twisting). Place touching on sheet tray.
Bake 15 minutes. Brush with 28g melted butter.
=== STUFFING ===
Toast or stale 375g bread cubes as desired. Butter a 9×13 pan.
Sauté 300g onion + 220g celery + 18g garlic in 227g butter for 8-10 minutes.
Add 10g sage, 10g parsley, 10g rosemary + 240g stock (1 cup from the 600g total).
Pour over bread, toss. Whisk 100g eggs + remaining 360g stock, pour in. Mix gently.
Bake at 350°F for 45-50 minutes to 160°F internal.
=== PUMPKIN SOUS VIDE CHEESECAKES (Yields ~8 jars) ===
Heat sous vide bath to 176°F (80°C).
Blend 452g cream cheese + 100g sugar + 2g salt until smooth.
Add 130g eggs + 5g vanilla, blend smooth. Add 130g buttermilk/cream while blending. Strain (optional).
For each jar: Combine 110g base + 20g pumpkin purée + 1g pumpkin spice, stir. Fill jars to 130g mark.
Close fingertip-tight. Cook 90 minutes. Rest 30 min, chill overnight.
=== GRAHAM STREUSEL TOPPING ===
Preheat oven to 325°F (163°C). Grind 105g graham crackers.
Mix with 55g melted butter + 25g sugar. Spread on tray.
Bake 18 minutes, stirring at 10 minutes. Cool fully. Top cheesecakes before serving.
notes: This is a complete Thanksgiving menu designed for 2025. All recipes converted to grams and ounces.
Chicken & Dumplings: Smoking the chicken is optional but highly recommended for flavor.
Mac & Cheese: Consider reducing sweet rub topping from 12g to 6g for better balance.
Vinegar Slaw: Recipe uses HALF the original salt/sugar purge amounts (24g salt, 66g sugar instead of 48g/133g) to prevent over-softening.
Pumpkin Cheesecake uses ratio of 110g base + 20g pumpkin per jar to maintain proper custard texture.
All measurements professionally converted with precise gram and ounce equivalents.
